dlgLine.text: Excuse me - have you heard anymore about what's causing this? Is there any new information?

dlgAnsw.text: Not that I know of.
Antibiotics will slow the effects.
Germs. Space germs. From space.
Who really cares. It's like asking if it's a Siberian or Bengal tiger that's about to pounce on me.

dlgLine.text: Oh...that's too bad. I was hoping someone had heard something - I just can't stop thinking of the possibilities and without my equipment, I feel completely useless-

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Yeah, I heard about that - it just raises more questions, don't you think? If I had known that back when I had access to my-

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Um... do you have a source for that? Because in my professional opinion, that sounds like a load of-

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I care. How can you not want to know? Someone has to be doing the research - oh, what I wouldn't give to be back in my-

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Hey! Get the hell away from my sister!
Mia - it's okay! Ben let them into the camp - they're not a threat.
How do we know?! Huh, Sara?! Can you tell? Can you read their minds? You know what the fuck these people are thinking? Do you?!
Hey, look at me... Calm down. Okay?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm just here to trade - that's all.
What the hell is her problem?
Maybe I should go.

dlgLine.text: You see, Mia?
Uh-huh... Right. Yeah... Okay, I'm sorry. I'm just... can't be too careful, right?
Excuse her, please. My sister's just been under a lot of stress ever since we left the city.

dlgAnsw.text: It's no problem - I understand completely.
Yeah, so? Who isn't?
What city? I'd appreciate any info you had.
You were saying something? You know, before we were interrupted.

dlgLine.text: Problem? Oh... I'm your problem now, you better fucking believe it!
<Sigh> ...C'mon, Mia.
Look, please... you have to understand, my sister's been under a lot of stress since we left the city.

dlgAnsw.text: What city? I'd appreciate any info you had.
It's no problem - I understand completely.
Yeah, so? Who isn't?
You were saying something? You know, before we were interrupted.

dlgLine.text: Yeah - go! Get out of here!
<Sigh> ...C'mon, Mia.
Wait a sec... You don't have to go, it's just that my sister's been really stressed since we left the city.

dlgAnsw.text: What city? I'd appreciate any info you had.
It's no problem - I understand completely.
Yeah, so? Who isn't?
You were saying something? You know, before we were interrupted.

dlgLine.text: Good. ...Mia?
What? Oh... Yeah, just stress. I, uh... I'm really sorry. She's my sister - just looking out for her, you know?
So... how have you been holding out? If you don't mind me asking.

dlgAnsw.text: We've been fortifying a school in Splendid. Kind of like this place, but bigger.
We keep to the road, mostly.
It's none of your business.

dlgLine.text: Why don't you just go then?
I'm sorry - this might not be a good time.
You don't have to treat me like a kid, okay? I can handle myself! Fuck, Sara...
You should go.

dlgAnsw.text: <The woman puts a hand on her sister's shoulder and whispers something to her.>

dlgLine.text: City? Psh... Who the hell would want to go there anymore. Just graves... Whole lot of graves...
Sorry, we... we were in Dallas for too long. You probably know already, but it's not safe in the cities anymore.
You just had to go back to the lab, didn't you.
Mia... I know.
Excuse me - what was I saying?

dlgAnsw.text: What do you do here?
Lab? What did she mean?
Are you happy here?
Nice meeting you both. I should go.

dlgLine.text: Right... About new info on the outside world. We don't really hear much here.
Not much of anything to do here. Let's all look at a tree, day after day after day after day. Sara can't get enough... Probably wishes she had a microscope to look at it closer.
Sometimes you go a little stir crazy. I do wish I could work, but...
Haven't I done enough for you? You had just had to go back to your goddamn lab, didn't you?!
Mia... I know.
It's safe here. We can't complain about that.

dlgAnsw.text: What do you do here?
Lab? What did she mean?
Are you happy here?
Nice meeting you both. I should go.

dlgLine.text: Really? That seems pretty risky.
Sara, use those big brains of yours - they're lying. Probably think if they tell us where they're from that we'll rob the place.
We wouldn't do that.
Sara, jeez... all those years of college. Balance the equation or whatever the fuck you did in that lab.
Look, you don't have to tell me where you're from. It's fine.

dlgAnsw.text: No, I'll tell you - we've been fortifying a school in Splendid. Kind of like this place, but bigger.
Lab? What did she mean?
Are you calling me a liar?

dlgLine.text: They put me in charge of... medicine. Which is not my field exactly, but... I guess I have more training than anyone else here.
Gretchen took after Dad... She's probably dead now, huh? You ever think about that Sara, huh?
Mia, please not now...
I'm not a doctor, if that's what you're thinking. No, here... we just help out in whatever way we can.

dlgAnsw.text: I could use a doctor. Are you sure you won't come with me.
Do you really think your skills are being put to the greatest use out here?
Good luck to you all the same. It was nice meeting you.

dlgLine.text: Really? And that works for you? Hm.
By bigger, what do you mean? Electricity? Hot showers? Oh my god, I'd blow someone for a hot shower in the morning.
Oh... Mia...
What? ...I would.

dlgAnsw.text: We always have room for more.
Our showers are piping hot.
Really?
Nice meeting you both... I should go.

dlgLine.text: I worked as a researcher in Dallas - I'm an immunologist. To put it bluntly, I thought I could help, but... things got out of control too quickly.
Why are you so polite all the time? It got fucked up, Sara - everything is fucked up. But I still love you... of all the sisters to get stuck with, I couldn't get by without you.

dlgAnsw.text: You're a scientist? I could use your help!
You should come back with us.
It ws nice talking to you both. I should be on my way.

dlgLine.text: Who the fuck is happy anymore?
We're... very safe here. I mean, I won't lie - I wish I was doing more to help, maybe at a research facility, but... it could be much worse - and Ben has been very good to us.
Ben? He thinks so small... That's why we're all still here instead of... I don't know, like a blimp or something.

dlgAnsw.text: You're a scientist? I could use your help!
You should come back with us.
It ws nice talking to you both. I should be on my way.

dlgLine.text: Yes, well... it was nice to talk to someone new.
Whatever, bye.

dlgAnsw.text: Good luck out here.
Yeah. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, I am. What are you going to do - hit me?
Don't make things worse, Mia.
C'mon, take a swing at me! I'm so fucking bored - let's do this!
That's enough. <The woman puts an arm on her sister's shoulder to hold her back>
I think you should go.

dlgAnsw.text: <The woman turns around and whispers something into her sister's ear.>

dlgLine.text: Oh, well... we're doing fine here. And... traveling is risky.
Learned that lesson the hard way, didn't we, Sara?
There's people here that need our help. That's it, really.

dlgAnsw.text: Look around - how long do you think this place will last? I can offer you security.
We're in Splendid if you change your mind. It was nice to meet you both.
I've got to get back on the road. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Oh, yeah?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I said it, didn't I?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: As I said, I'm not really a doctor. I worked in immunology - yes, I've had some training, but I'm a researcher primarily.

dlgAnsw.text: I could always use a scientist too.
Look around - how long do you think this place will last? I can offer you security.
I see. Well, if you change your mind, we're in Splendid. Nice meeting you.

dlgLine.text: I don't know what good I would be... Without the right equipment, there's not much I can do and... there are people counting on me here.

dlgAnsw.text: We've got a lab. You could do great work there - maybe even save some lives with your research.
Look around - how long do you think this place will last? I can offer you security.
We're in Splendid if you change your mind. It was nice to meet you both.

dlgLine.text: No, but that doesn't mean there aren't people counting on me.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: You'd have to offer a lot more than that... TV, hot showers - internet would be nice too.
Mia, lower your voice.
No, let's milk this. My sister here's a genius scientist. What is that worth to you?
Ben took us in when we had nowhere else to go.
Fuck him. Let's see what we can get. Stop being so fucking modest all the time.
Mia... You're in no state to-
Hey, I'm listening - make us an offer!

dlgAnsw.text: I won't lie - you're going to have to work same as anyone.
You want electricity, water heaters, books, guns - we've got all of that.
Couple of pretty girls like you... You could never leave your bed and still earn your keep there.
You won't find a better shelter in Central Texas - we've built everything you could need.

dlgLine.text: So, same as here? Ugh... Thanks for getting me excited for nothing.
I'm sorry - as I said, we've already got a place here.

dlgAnsw.text: If you change your mind, come find me in Splendid.
Fine, stay here and die. Don't say I didn't try to help.

dlgLine.text: Fucking creep!
Ugh... Please just go.

dlgAnsw.text: Fine be that way. Bitches.
You'll be begging me to let you in. Mark my words.

dlgLine.text: C'mon, Sara - you know it's not going to work here.
What about these people? And Ben? We can't just leave, Mia.
I don't care - I'm sick of this place and I'm going. I've made up my mind! Now, c'mon, you're my sister - are you really going to choose them over me?
I... You know I'm not going to. So, I guess we're going then.
I'll get our stuff. You tell Ben, then we hit the road and get the hell out of Camp Jack-Shit-To-Do.
Okay...

dlgAnsw.text: Welcome to the winning side, ladies. Let's go.
You won't regret it. Follow me.

dlgLine.text: A lab? Really?
Finally, you can't stop talking about wanting to get back in the lab and I can stop hearing about it.
Look... I'm very tempted, but Ben took me in when we had nowhere else to go. If he says it's alright, maybe...

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, I'll ask him.
Pack your things, because I always get what I want. Be back in a sec.

dlgLine.text: Did you talk to Ben?

dlgAnsw.text: He says your free to go with me, if you want.
Not yet. Let me see if I can convince him.

dlgLine.text: Oh... Okay. I guess we should say our goodbyes and-
I'll pack our stuff, Sara.
That's that, then... Funny, I never thought I'd miss this place. But it will be good to get back to work.

dlgAnsw.text: Good to have you on the team. Let's go.
I'm sure you'll fit right in. Now, follow me.

dlgLine.text: Oh... Hi.

dlgAnsw.text: Did you say you were a scientist? We could use your help.
You should come back with us.
Hello again. Just passing through. See ya.
